bug.author: bhaskoro-muthohar
bug.description:
Describe the bug Hi, I tried to run ProfileReport but raised an error To Reproduce from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport
prof = ProfileReport(df1) prof.to_file(output_file='output.html') Data: My Dataframe from a CSV which looks like this: <denchmark-code>booking_date,city,Count 14-12-17, Balikpapan,2 14-12-17, Bandar Lampung,7 14-12-17, Bandung,71 14-12-17, Banjarmasin,2 14-12-17, Bantul,1 14-12-17, Batam,2 ... </denchmark-code>
Error: : HBox(children=(FloatProgress(value=0.0, description='variables', max=3.0, style=ProgressStyle(description_widtâ€¦

~\AppData\Roaming\Python\Python37\site-packages\visions\core\model\type.py in <module> 38 39 ---> 40 @attr.s(frozen=True) 41 class TypeRelation: 42 """Relationship encoder between implementations of :class:`visions.core.models.VisionsBaseType`
AttributeError: module 'attr' has no attribute 's' --> Version information:

comments.comment: Try pip uninstall attr pip install attrs
Same here. pip uninstall attr and install did not work. (Using windows with anaconda and jupyter notebook)

Try pip uninstall attr pip install attrs
Did not work for me
It's an issue with one of our dependencies. I'll make a new release, that should fix it. It might take a few days before the conda forge version is up-to-date too.
changing from attr to attrs worked for me
Along with uninstalling attr package, using the minimal = True option worked for me. "profile = ProfileReport(large_dataset, minimal=True)"

Tried with !pip uninstall attr !pip install attrs Now am unable to launch Notebook as well. Getting, Traceback (most recent call last): File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\Scripts\jupyter-notebook-script.py", line 6, in from notebook.notebookapp import main File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
otebook
otebookapp.py", line 80, in from .services.contents.manager import ContentsManager File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
otebook\services\contents\manager.py", line 17, in from nbformat import sign, validate as validate_nb, ValidationError File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
bformat_init_.py", line 32, in from .validator import validate, ValidationError File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\lib\site-packages
bformat\validator.py", line 12, in from jsonschema import ValidationError File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\jsonschema_init_.py", line 11, in from jsonschema.exceptions import ( File "C:\Users\Harish\anaconda3\lib\site-packages\jsonschema\exceptions.py", line 152, in @attr.s(hash=True) AttributeError: module 'attr' has no attribute 's'

Along with uninstalling attr package, using the minimal = True option worked for me. "profile = ProfileReport(large_dataset, minimal=True)"
Thanks worked for me too
Should be fixed in the v2.6.0 release.
